name: ditrans,polycis-polyprenyl diphosphate synthase [(2E,6E)-farnesyl diphosphate specific]
reaction: (2E,6E)-farnesyl diphosphate + n isopentenyl diphosphate = n diphosphate + ditrans,polycis-polyprenyl diphosphate (n = 10--55)

name: all-trans-decaprenyl-diphosphate synthase
reaction: (2E,6E)-farnesyl diphosphate + 7 isopentenyl diphosphate = 7 diphosphate + all-trans-decaprenyl diphosphate

name: ornithine aminotransferase
reaction: L-ornithine + a 2-oxo carboxylate = L-glutamate 5-semialdehyde + an L-amino acid

name: 2'-phosphotransferase
reaction: 2'-phospho-[ligated tRNA] + NAD+ = mature tRNA + ADP-ribose 1'',2''-phosphate + nicotinamide + H2O

name: nucleoside-diphosphate kinase
reaction: ATP + nucleoside diphosphate = ADP + nucleoside triphosphate

name: nucleoside-triphosphate---adenylate kinase
reaction: nucleoside triphosphate + AMP = nucleoside diphosphate + ADP

name: diphosphoinositol-pentakisphosphate kinase
reaction: ATP + 1D-myo-inositol 5-diphosphate pentakisphosphate = ADP + 1D-myo-inositol bisdiphosphate tetrakisphosphate (isomeric configuration unknown)

name: polyribonucleotide nucleotidyltransferase
reaction: RNAn+1 + phosphate = RNAn + a nucleoside diphosphate

name: CCA tRNA nucleotidyltransferase
reaction: a tRNA precursor + 2 CTP + ATP = a tRNA with a 3' CCA end + 3 diphosphate (overall reaction)

name: tRNAHis guanylyltransferase
reaction: p-tRNAHis + ATP + GTP = pppGp-tRNAHis + AMP + diphosphate (overall reaction)

name: UDP-N-acetylglucosamine---lysosomal-enzyme N-acetylglucosaminephosphotransferase
reaction: UDP-N-acetyl-D-glucosamine + lysosomal-enzyme D-mannose = UMP + lysosomal-enzyme N-acetyl-D-glucosaminyl-phospho-D-mannose

name: sphingomyelin synthase
reaction: a ceramide + a phosphatidylcholine = a sphingomyelin + a 1,2-diacyl-sn-glycerol

name: selenide, water dikinase
reaction: ATP + selenide + H2O = AMP + selenophosphate + phosphate

name: non-specific serine/threonine protein kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: cAMP-dependent protein kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: cGMP-dependent protein kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: protein kinase C
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: phosphorylase kinase
reaction: 2 ATP + phosphorylase b = 2 ADP + phosphorylase a

name: polo kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: cyclin-dependent kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: mitogen-activated protein kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: dual-specificity kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase
reaction: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein

name: lipoyl synthase
reaction: protein N6-(octanoyl)lysine + 2 sulfur-(sulfur carrier) + 2 S-adenosyl-L-methionine = protein N6-(lipoyl)lysine + 2 (sulfur carrier) + 2 L-methionine + 2 5'-deoxyadenosine

name: molybdenum cofactor sulfurtransferase
reaction: molybdenum cofactor + L-cysteine + 2 H+ = thio-molybdenum cofactor + L-alanine + H2O

name: aryl sulfotransferase
reaction: 3'-phosphoadenylyl sulfate + a phenol = adenosine 3',5'-bisphosphate + an aryl sulfate

name: alcohol sulfotransferase
reaction: 3'-phosphoadenylyl sulfate + an alcohol = adenosine 3',5'-bisphosphate + an alkyl sulfate

name: galactosylceramide sulfotransferase
reaction: 3'-phosphoadenylyl sulfate + a galactosylceramide = adenosine 3',5'-bisphosphate + a galactosylceramidesulfate

name: protein-tyrosine sulfotransferase
reaction: 3'-phosphoadenylyl sulfate + protein tyrosine = adenosine 3',5'-bisphosphate + protein tyrosine-O-sulfate

name: carboxylesterase
reaction: a carboxylic ester + H2O = an alcohol + a carboxylate

name: arylesterase
reaction: a phenyl acetate + H2O = a phenol + acetate

name: cholinesterase
reaction: an acylcholine + H2O = choline + a carboxylate

name: sterol esterase
reaction: a steryl ester + H2O = a sterol + a fatty acid

name: acylglycerol lipase
reaction: Hydrolyses glycerol monoesters of long-chain fatty acids

name: aminoacyl-tRNA hydrolase
reaction: N-substituted aminoacyl-tRNA + H2O = N-substituted amino acid + tRNA

name: retinoid isomerohydrolase
reaction: an all-trans-retinyl ester + H2O = 11-cis-retinol + a fatty acid

name: acyloxyacyl hydrolase
reaction: 3-(acyloxy)acyl group of bacterial toxin + H2O = 3-hydroxyacyl group of bacterial toxin + a fatty acid

name: cocaine esterase
reaction: cocaine + H2O = ecgonine methyl ester + benzoate

name: ubiquitin thiolesterase
reaction: ubiquitin C-terminal thioester + H2O = ubiquitin + a thiol

name: alkaline phosphatase
reaction: a phosphate monoester + H2O = an alcohol + phosphate

name: acid phosphatase
reaction: a phosphate monoester + H2O = an alcohol + phosphate

name: phosphoserine phosphatase
reaction: O-phospho-L(or D)-serine + H2O = L(or D)-serine + phosphate

name: phosphoprotein phosphatase
reaction: a phosphoprotein + H2O = a protein + phosphate

name: protein-tyrosine-phosphatase
reaction: protein tyrosine phosphate + H2O = protein tyrosine + phosphate

name: multiple inositol-polyphosphate phosphatase
reaction: myo-inositol hexakisphosphate + H2O = myo-inositol pentakisphosphate (mixed isomers) + phosphate

name: phosphodiesterase I
reaction: Hydrolytically removes 5'-nucleotides successively from the 3'-hydroxy termini of 3'-hydroxy-terminated oligonucleotides

name: phospholipase D
reaction: a phosphatidylcholine + H2O = choline + a phosphatidate

name: sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase
reaction: a sphingomyelin + H2O = a ceramide + phosphocholine

name: N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphodiester alpha-N-acetylglucosaminidase
reaction: glycoprotein N-acetyl-D-glucosaminyl-phospho-D-mannose + H2O = N-acetyl-D-glucosamine + glycoprotein phospho-D-mannose

name: N-acetylgalactosamine-6-sulfatase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the 6-sulfate groups of the N-acetyl-D-galactosamine 6-sulfate units of chondroitin sulfate and of the D-galactose 6-sulfate units of keratan sulfate

name: cerebroside-sulfatase
reaction: a cerebroside 3-sulfate + H2O = a cerebroside + sulfate

name: N-acetylgalactosamine-4-sulfatase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the 4-sulfate groups of the N-acetyl-D-galactosamine 4-sulfate units of chondroitin sulfate and dermatan sulfate

name: iduronate-2-sulfatase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the 2-sulfate groups of the L-iduronate 2-sulfate units of dermatan sulfate, heparan sulfate and heparin

name: N-acetylglucosamine-6-sulfatase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the 6-sulfate groups of the N-acetyl-D-glucosamine 6-sulfate units of heparan sulfate and keratan sulfate

name: aryldialkylphosphatase
reaction: an aryl dialkyl phosphate + H2O = dialkyl phosphate + an aryl alcohol

name: exodeoxyribonuclease III
reaction: Exonucleolytic cleavage in the 3'- to 5'-direction to yield nucleoside 5'-phosphates

name: exoribonuclease II
reaction: Exonucleolytic cleavage in the 3'- to 5'-direction to yield nucleoside 5'-phosphates

name: deoxyribonuclease II
reaction: Endonucleolytic cleavage to nucleoside 3'-phosphates and 3'-phosphooligonucleotide end-products

name: ribonuclease P
reaction: Endonucleolytic cleavage of RNA, removing 5'-extranucleotides from tRNA precursor

name: tRNase Z
reaction: endonucleolytic cleavage of RNA, removing extra 3' nucleotides from tRNA precursor, generating 3' termini of tRNAs. A 3'-hydroxy group is left at the tRNA terminus and a 5'-phosphoryl group is left at the trailer molecule

name: ribonuclease T2
reaction: Two-stage endonucleolytic cleavage to nucleoside 3'-phosphates and 3'-phosphooligonucleotides with 2',3'-cyclic phosphate intermediates

name: pancreatic ribonuclease
reaction: Endonucleolytic cleavage to nucleoside 3'-phosphates and 3'-phosphooligonucleotides ending in Cp or Up with 2',3'-cyclic phosphate intermediates

name: tRNA-intron endonuclease
reaction: Endonucleolytic cleavage of pre-tRNA, producing 5'-hydroxy and 2',3'-cyclic phosphate termini, and specifically removing the intron

name: alpha-amylase
reaction: Endohydrolysis of (1->4)-alpha-D-glucosidic linkages in polysaccharides containing three or more (1->4)-alpha-linked D-glucose units

name: glucan 1,4-alpha-glucosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal (1->4)-linked alpha-D-glucose residues successively from non-reducing ends of the chains with release of beta-D-glucose

name: oligo-1,6-glucosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of (1->6)-alpha-D-glucosidic linkages in some oligosaccharides produced from starch and glycogen by EC 3.2.1.1 (alpha-amylase), and in isomaltose

name: chitinase
reaction: Random hydrolysis of N-acetyl-beta-D-glucosaminide (1->4)-beta-linkages in chitin and chitodextrins

name: lysozyme
reaction: Hydrolysis of (1->4)-beta-linkages between N-acetylmuramic acid and N-acetyl-D-glucosamine residues in a peptidoglycan and between N-acetyl-D-glucosamine residues in chitodextrins

name: exo-alpha-sialidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of alpha-(2->3)-, alpha-(2->6)-, alpha-(2->8)- glycosidic linkages of terminal sialic acid residues in oligosaccharides, glycoproteins, glycolipids, colominic acid and synthetic substrates

name: alpha-glucosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing (1->4)-linked alpha-D-glucose residues with release of D-glucose

name: beta-glucosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing beta-D-glucosyl residues with release of beta-D-glucose

name: alpha-galactosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing alpha-D-galactose residues in alpha-D-galactosides, including galactose oligosaccharides, galactomannans and galactolipids

name: beta-galactosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal non-reducing beta-D-galactose residues in beta-D-galactosides

name: alpha-mannosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing alpha-D-mannose residues in alpha-D-mannosides

name: beta-mannosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing beta-D-mannose residues in beta-D-mannosides

name: beta-glucuronidase
reaction: a beta-D-glucuronoside + H2O = D-glucuronate + an alcohol

name: amylo-alpha-1,6-glucosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of (1->6)-alpha-D-glucosidic branch linkages in glycogen phosphorylase limit dextrin

name: hyaluronoglucosaminidase
reaction: Random hydrolysis of (1->4)-linkages between N-acetyl-beta-D-glucosamine and D-glucuronate residues in hyaluronate

name: glucosylceramidase
reaction: a D-glucosyl-N-acylsphingosine + H2O = D-glucose + a ceramide

name: galactosylceramidase
reaction: a D-galactosyl-N-acylsphingosine + H2O = D-galactose + a ceramide

name: sucrose alpha-glucosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of sucrose and maltose by an alpha-D-glucosidase-type action

name: alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase
reaction: Cleavage of non-reducing alpha-(1->3)-N-acetylgalactosamine residues from human blood group A and AB mucin glycoproteins, Forssman hapten and blood group A lacto series glycolipids

name: alpha-N-acetylglucosaminidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal non-reducing N-acetyl-D-glucosamine residues in N-acetyl-alpha-D-glucosaminides

name: alpha-L-fucosidase
reaction: an alpha-L-fucoside + H2O = L-fucose + an alcohol

name: beta-N-acetylhexosaminidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of terminal non-reducing N-acetyl-D-hexosamine residues in N-acetyl-beta-D-hexosaminides

name: glycosylceramidase
reaction: a glycosyl-N-acylsphingosine + H2O = a ceramide + a sugar

name: L-iduronidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of unsulfated alpha-L-iduronosidic linkages in dermatan sulfate

name: mannosyl-glycoprotein endo-beta-N-acetylglucosaminidase
reaction: Endohydrolysis of the N,N'-diacetylchitobiosyl unit in high-mannose glycopeptides and glycoproteins containing the -[Man(GlcNAc)2]Asn- structure. One N-acetyl-D-glucosamine residue remains attached to the protein the rest of the oligosaccharide is released intact

name: mannosyl-oligosaccharide glucosidase
reaction: Exohydrolysis of the non-reducing terminal glucose residues in the mannosyl-oligosaccharide Glc3Man9GlcNAc2

name: mannosyl-oligosaccharide 1,2-alpha-mannosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the terminal (1->2)-linked alpha-D-mannose residues in the oligo-mannose oligosaccharide Man9(GlcNAc)2

name: mannosyl-oligosaccharide 1,3-1,6-alpha-mannosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the terminal (1->3)- and (1->6)-linked alpha-D-mannose residues in the mannosyl-oligosaccharide Man5(GlcNAc)3

name: glycoprotein endo-alpha-1,2-mannosidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the terminal alpha-D-glucosyl-(1,3)-D-mannosyl unit from the GlcMan9(GlcNAc)2 oligosaccharide component of the glycoprotein produced in the Golgi membrane

name: poly(ADP-ribose) glycohydrolase
reaction: hydrolyses poly(ADP-D-ribose) at glycosidic (1''-2') linkage of ribose-ribose bond to produce free ADP-D-ribose

name: heparanase
reaction: endohydrolysis of (1->4)-beta-D-glycosidic bonds of heparan sulfate chains in heparan sulfate proteoglycan

name: DNA-3-methyladenine glycosylase II
reaction: Hydrolysis of alkylated DNA, releasing 3-methyladenine, 3-methylguanine, 7-methylguanine and 7-methyladenine

name: uracil-DNA glycosylase
reaction: Hydrolyses single-stranded DNA or mismatched double-stranded DNA and polynucleotides, releasing free uracil

name: leucyl aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Xaa!Yaa-, in which Xaa is preferably Leu, but may be other amino acids including Pro although not Arg or Lys, and Yaa may be Pro. Amino acid amides and methyl esters are also readily hydrolysed, but rates on arylamides are exceedingly low

name: membrane alanyl aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Xaa!Yaa- from a peptide, amide or arylamide. Xaa is preferably Ala, but may be most amino acids including Pro (slow action). When a terminal hydrophobic residue is followed by a prolyl residue, the two may be released as an intact Xaa-Pro dipeptide

name: cystinyl aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Cys!Xaa-, in which the half-cystine residue is involved in a disulfide loop, notably in oxytocin or vasopressin. Hydrolysis rates on a range of aminoacyl arylamides exceed that for the cystinyl derivative, however

name: prolyl aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of N-terminal proline from a peptide

name: aminopeptidase B
reaction: Release of N-terminal Arg and Lys from oligopeptides when P1' is not Pro. Also acts on arylamides of Arg and Lys

name: glutamyl aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of N-terminal glutamate (and to a lesser extent aspartate) from a peptide

name: Xaa-Pro aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of any N-terminal amino acid, including proline, that is linked to proline, even from a dipeptide or tripeptide

name: methionyl aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of N-terminal amino acids, preferentially methionine, from peptides and arylamides

name: aspartyl aminopeptidase
reaction: Release of an N-terminal aspartate or glutamate from a peptide, with a preference for aspartate

name: Xaa-Pro dipeptidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of Xaa!Pro dipeptides also acts on aminoacyl-hydroxyproline analogs. No action on Pro-Pro

name: cytosol nonspecific dipeptidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of dipeptides, preferentially hydrophobic dipeptides including prolyl amino acids

name: beta-Ala-His dipeptidase
reaction: Preferential hydrolysis of the beta-Ala!His dipeptide (carnosine), and also anserine, Xaa!His dipeptides and other dipeptides including homocarnosine

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase I
reaction: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide, Xaa-Yaa!Zaa-, except when Xaa is Arg or Lys, or Yaa or Zaa is Pro

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase II
reaction: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide, Xaa-Yaa!, preferentially when Yaa is Ala or Pro. Substrates are oligopeptides, preferentially tripeptides

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase III
reaction: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide from a peptide comprising four or more residues, with broad specificity. Also acts on dipeptidyl 2-naphthylamides.

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase IV
reaction: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide, Xaa-Yaa!Zaa-, from a polypeptide, preferentially when Yaa is Pro, provided Zaa is neither Pro nor hydroxyproline

name: tripeptidyl-peptidase I
reaction: Release of an N-terminal tripeptide from a polypeptide, but also has endopeptidase activity.

name: tripeptidyl-peptidase II
reaction: Release of an N-terminal tripeptide from a polypeptide

name: peptidyl-dipeptidase A
reaction: Release of a C-terminal dipeptide, oligopeptide!Xaa-Yaa, when Xaa is not Pro, and Yaa is neither Asp nor Glu. Thus, conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, with increase in vasoconstrictor activity, but no action on angiotensin II

name: lysosomal Pro-Xaa carboxypeptidase
reaction: Cleavage of a -Pro!Xaa bond to release a C-terminal amino acid

name: carboxypeptidase C
reaction: Release of a C-terminal amino acid with broad specificity

name: carboxypeptidase A
reaction: Release of a C-terminal amino acid, but little or no action with -Asp, -Glu, -Arg, -Lys or -Pro

name: carboxypeptidase B
reaction: Preferential release of a C-terminal lysine or arginine amino acid

name: lysine carboxypeptidase
reaction: Release of a C-terminal basic amino acid, preferentially lysine

name: carboxypeptidase E
reaction: Release of C-terminal arginine or lysine residues from polypeptides

name: carboxypeptidase M
reaction: Cleavage of C-terminal arginine or lysine residues from polypeptides

name: carboxypeptidase A2
reaction: Similar to that of carboxypeptidase A (EC 3.4.17.1), but with a preference for bulkier C-terminal residues

name: carboxypeptidase U
reaction: Release of C-terminal Arg and Lys from a polypeptide

name: glutamate carboxypeptidase II
reaction: Release of an unsubstituted, C-terminal glutamyl residue, typically from Ac-Asp-Glu or folylpoly-gamma-glutamates

name: metallocarboxypeptidase D
reaction: Releases C-terminal Arg and Lys from polypeptides

name: cathepsin X
reaction: Release of C-terminal amino acid residues with broad specificity, but lacks action on C-terminal proline. Shows weak endopeptidase activity

name: acylaminoacyl-peptidase
reaction: Cleavage of an N-acetyl or N-formyl amino acid from the N-terminus of a polypeptide

name: pyroglutamyl-peptidase I
reaction: Release of an N-terminal pyroglutamyl group from a polypeptide, the second amino acid generally not being Pro

name: beta-aspartyl-peptidase
reaction: Cleavage of a beta-linked Asp residue from the N-terminus of a polypeptide

name: pyroglutamyl-peptidase II
reaction: Release of the N-terminal pyroglutamyl group from pGlu!His-Xaa tripeptides and pGlu!His-Xaa-Gly tetrapeptides

name: ubiquitinyl hydrolase 1
reaction: Thiol-dependent hydrolysis of ester, thioester, amide, peptide and isopeptide bonds formed by the C-terminal Gly of ubiquitin (a 76-residue protein attached to proteins as an intracellular targeting signal)

name: chymotrypsin
reaction: Preferential cleavage: Tyr!, Trp!, Phe!, Leu!

name: chymotrypsin C
reaction: Preferential cleavage: Leu!, Tyr!, Phe!, Met!, Trp!, Gln!, Asn!

name: thrombin
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Gly bonds in fibrinogen to form fibrin and release fibrinopeptides A and B

name: coagulation factor Xa
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Thr and then Arg!Ile bonds in prothrombin to form thrombin

name: plasmin
reaction: Preferential cleavage: Lys! > Arg! higher selectivity than trypsin. Converts fibrin into soluble products

name: enteropeptidase
reaction: Activation of trypsinogen by selective cleavage of Lys6!Ile bond

name: coagulation factor VIIa
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Ile bond in factor X to form factor Xa

name: coagulation factor IXa
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Ile bond in factor X to form factor Xa

name: prolyl oligopeptidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of ---Pro! and to a lesser extent ---Ala! in oligopeptides

name: coagulation factor XIa
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Ala and Arg!Val bonds in factor IX to form factor IXa

name: plasma kallikrein
reaction: Selective cleavage of some Arg! and Lys! bonds, including Lys!Arg and Arg!Ser in (human) kininogen to release bradykinin

name: tissue kallikrein
reaction: Preferential cleavage of Arg! bonds in small molecule substrates. Highly selective action to release kallidin (lysyl-bradykinin) from kininogen involves hydrolysis of Met! or Leu!. The rat enzyme is unusual in liberating bradykinin directly from autologous kininogens by cleavage at two Arg! bonds

name: pancreatic elastase
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins, including elastin. Preferential cleavage: Ala!

name: leukocyte elastase
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins, including elastin. Preferential cleavage Val! > Ala!

name: coagulation factor XIIa
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Ile bonds in factor VII to form factor VIIa and factor XI to form factor XIa

name: chymase
reaction: Preferential cleavage: Phe! > Tyr! > Trp! > Leu!

name: complement subcomponent C_overbar_1r_
reaction: Selective cleavage of Lys(or Arg)!Ile bond in complement subcomponent C1s to form C_overbar_1s_ (EC 3.4.21.42)

name: complement subcomponent C_overbar_1s_
reaction: Cleavage of Arg!Ala bond in complement component C4 to form C4a and C4b, and Lys(or Arg)!Lys bond in complement component C2 to form C2a and C2b: the "classical" pathway C3 convertase

name: classical-complement-pathway C3/C5 convertase
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Ser bond in complement component C3 alpha-chain to form C3a and C3b, and Arg! bond in complement component C5 alpha-chain to form C5a and C5b

name: complement factor I
reaction: Inactivates complement subcomponents C3b, iC3b and C4b by proteolytic cleavage

name: complement factor D
reaction: Selective cleavage of Arg!Lys bond in complement factor B when in complex with complement subcomponent C3b or with cobra venom factor

name: alternative-complement-pathway C3/C5 convertase
reaction: Cleavage of Arg!Ser bond in complement component C3 alpha-chain to yield C3a and C3b, and Arg! bond in complement component C5 alpha-chain to yield C5a and C5b

name: endopeptidase La
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins in presence of ATP

name: tryptase
reaction: Preferential cleavage: Arg!, Lys!, but with more restricted specificity than trypsin

name: t-plasminogen activator
reaction: Specific cleavage of Arg!Val bond in plasminogen to form plasmin

name: protein C (activated)
reaction: Degradation of blood coagulation factors Va and VIIIa

name: pancreatic endopeptidase E
reaction: Preferential cleavage: Ala!. Does not hydrolyse elastin

name: pancreatic elastase II
reaction: Preferential cleavage: Leu!, Met! and Phe!. Hydrolyses elastin

name: u-plasminogen activator
reaction: Specific cleavage of Arg!Val bond in plasminogen to form plasmin

name: furin
reaction: Release of mature proteins from their proproteins by cleavage of -Arg-Xaa-Yaa-Arg! bonds, where Xaa can by any amino acid and Yaa is Arg or Lys. Releases albumin, complement component C3 and von Willebrand factor from their respective precursors

name: myeloblastin
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins, including elastin, by preferential cleavage: -Ala! > -Val!

name: granzyme A
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins, including fibronectin, type IV collagen and nucleolin. Preferential cleavage: -Arg!, -Lys! >> -Phe! in small molecule substrates

name: endopeptidase Clp
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins to small peptides in the presence of ATP and Mg2+. alpha-Casein is the usual test substrate. In the absence of ATP, only oligopeptides shorter than five residues are hydrolysed (such as succinyl-Leu-Tyr!NHMec and Leu-Tyr-Leu!Tyr-Trp, in which cleavage of the -Tyr!Leu- and -Tyr!Trp bonds also occurs)

name: proprotein convertase 1
reaction: Release of protein hormones, neuropeptides and renin from their precursors, generally by hydrolysis of -Lys-Arg! bonds

name: proprotein convertase 2
reaction: Release of protein hormones and neuropeptides from their precursors, generally by hydrolysis of -Lys-Arg! bonds

name: mannan-binding lectin-associated serine protease-2
reaction: Selective cleavage after Arg223 in complement component C2 (-Ser-Leu-Gly-Arg!Lys-Ile-Gln-Ile) and after Arg76 in complement component C4 (-Gly-Leu-Gln-Arg!Ala-Leu-Glu-Ile)

name: rhomboid protease
reaction: Cleaves type-1 transmembrane domains using a catalytic dyad composed of serine and histidine that are contributed by different transmembrane domains

name: HtrA2 peptidase
reaction: Cleavage of non-polar aliphatic amino-acids at the P1 position, with a preference for Val, Ile and Met. At the P2 and P3 positions, Arg is selected most strongly with a secondary preference for other hydrophilic residues

name: matriptase
reaction: Cleaves various synthetic substrates with Arg or Lys at the P1 position and prefers small side-chain amino acids, such as Ala and Gly, at the P2 position

name: site-1 protease
reaction: Processes precursors containing basic and hydrophobic/aliphatic residues at P4 and P2, respectively, with a relatively relaxed acceptance of amino acids at P1 and P3

name: stratum corneum chymotryptic enzyme
reaction: Cleavage of proteins with aromatic side chains in the P1 position

name: kallikrein 8
reaction: Cleavage of amide substrates following the basic amino acids Arg or Lys at the P1 position, with a preference for Arg over Lys

name: cathepsin B
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds. Preferentially cleaves -Arg-Arg! bonds in small molecule substrates (thus differing from cathepsin L). In addition to being an endopeptidase, shows peptidyl-dipeptidase activity, liberating C-terminal dipeptides

name: cathepsin L
reaction: Similar to that of papain. As compared to cathepsin B, cathepsin L exhibits higher activity towards protein substrates, but has little activity on Z-Arg-Arg-NHMec, and no peptidyl-dipeptidase activity

name: cathepsin H
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins, acting as an aminopeptidase (notably, cleaving Arg! bonds) as well as an endopeptidase

name: cathepsin S
reaction: Similar to cathepsin L, but with much less activity on Z-Phe-Arg!NHMec, and more activity on the Z-Val-Val-Arg! compound

name: legumain
reaction: Hydrolysis of proteins and small molecule substrates at -Asn!Xaa- bonds

name: caspase-1
reaction: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at position P1 and has a preferred cleavage sequence of Tyr-Val-Ala-Asp!

name: cathepsin K
reaction: Broad proteolytic activity. With small-molecule substrates and inhibitors, the major determinant of specificity is P2, which is preferably Leu, Met > Phe, and not Arg

name: bleomycin hydrolase
reaction: Inactivates bleomycin B2 (a cytotoxic glycometallopeptide) by hydrolysis of a carboxyamide bond of beta-aminoalanine, but also shows general aminopeptidase activity. The specificity varies somewhat with source, but amino acid arylamides of Met, Leu and Ala are preferred

name: cathepsin F
reaction: The recombinant enzyme cleaves synthetic substrates with Phe and Leu (better than Val) in P2, with high specificity constant (kcat/Km) comparable to that of cathepsin L

name: cathepsin O
reaction: The recombinant human enzyme hydrolyses synthetic endopeptidase substrates including Z-Phe-Arg-NHMec and Z-Arg-Arg-NHMec

name: cathepsin V
reaction: The recombinant enzyme hydrolyses proteins (serum albumin, collagen) and synthetic substrates (Z-Phe-Arg-NHMec > Z-Leu-Arg-NHMec > Z-Val-Arg-NHMec)

name: separase
reaction: All bonds known to be hydrolysed by this endopeptidase have arginine in P1 and an acidic residue in P4. P6 is often occupied by an acidic residue or by an hydroxy-amino-acid residue, the phosphorylation of which enhances cleavage

name: caspase-2
reaction: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at P1, with Asp316 being essential for proteolytic activity and has a preferred cleavage sequence of Val-Asp-Val-Ala-Asp!

name: caspase-3
reaction: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at positions P1 and P4. It has a preferred cleavage sequence of Asp-Xaa-Xaa-Asp! with a hydrophobic amino-acid residue at P2 and a hydrophilic amino-acid residue at P3, although Val or Ala are also accepted at this position

name: caspase-4
reaction: Strict requirement for Asp at the P1 position. It has a preferred cleavage sequence of Tyr-Val-Ala-Asp! but also cleaves at Asp-Glu-Val-Asp!

name: caspase-5
reaction: Strict requirement for Asp at the P1 position. It has a preferred cleavage sequence of Tyr-Val-Ala-Asp! but also cleaves at Asp-Glu-Val-Asp!

name: caspase-6
reaction: Strict requirement for Asp at position P1 and has a preferred cleavage sequence of Val-Glu-His-Asp!

name: caspase-7
reaction: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at position P1 and has a preferred cleavage sequence of Asp-Glu-Val-Asp!

name: caspase-8
reaction: Strict requirement for Asp at position P1 and has a preferred cleavage sequence of (Leu/Asp/Val)-Glu-Thr-Asp!(Gly/Ser/Ala)

name: caspase-9
reaction: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at position P1 and with a marked preference for His at position P2. It has a preferred cleavage sequence of Leu-Gly-His-Asp!Xaa

name: caspase-10
reaction: Strict requirement for Asp at position P1 and has a preferred cleavage sequence of Leu-Gln-Thr-Asp!Gly

name: Ulp1 peptidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of the alpha-linked peptide bond in the sequence Gly-Gly!Ala-Thr-Tyr at the C-terminal end of the small ubiquitin-like modifier (SUMO) propeptide, Smt3, leading to the mature form of the protein. A second reaction involves the cleavage of an epsilon-linked peptide bond between the C-terminal glycine of the mature SUMO and the lysine epsilon-amino group of the target protein

name: pepsin A
reaction: Preferential cleavage: hydrophobic, preferably aromatic, residues in P1 and P1' positions. Cleaves Phe1!Val, Gln4!His, Glu13!Ala, Ala14!Leu, Leu15!Tyr, Tyr16!Leu, Gly23!Phe, Phe24!Phe and Phe25!Tyr bonds in the B chain of insulin

name: gastricsin
reaction: More restricted specificity than pepsin A, but shows preferential cleavage at Tyr! bonds. High activity on hemoglobin

name: cathepsin D
reaction: Specificity similar to, but narrower than, that of pepsin A. Does not cleave the Gln4-His bond in B chain of insulin

name: renin
reaction: Cleavage of Leu! bond in angiotensinogen to generate angiotensin I

name: cathepsin E
reaction: Similar to cathepsin D, but slightly broader specificity

name: memapsin 1
reaction: Broad endopeptidase specificity. Cleaves Glu-Val-Asn-Leu!Asp-Ala-Glu-Phe in the Swedish variant of Alzheimer's amyloid precursor protein

name: memapsin 2
reaction: Broad endopeptidase specificity. Cleaves Glu-Val-Asn-Leu!Asp-Ala-Glu-Phe in the Swedish variant of Alzheimer's amyloid precursor protein

name: interstitial collagenase
reaction: Cleavage of the triple helix of collagen at about three-quarters of the length of the molecule from the N-terminus, at Gly775!Ile in the alpha1(I) chain. Cleaves synthetic substrates and alpha-macroglobulins at bonds where P1' is a hydrophobic residue

name: neprilysin
reaction: Preferential cleavage of polypeptides between hydrophobic residues, particularly with Phe or Tyr at P1'

name: procollagen N-endopeptidase
reaction: Cleaves the N-propeptide of collagen chain alpha1(I) at Pro!Gln and of alpha1(II) and alpha2(I) at Ala!Gln

name: thimet oligopeptidase
reaction: Preferential cleavage of bonds with hydrophobic residues at P1, P2 and P3' and a small residue at P1' in substrates of 5-15 residues

name: stromelysin 1
reaction: Preferential cleavage where P1', P2' and P3' are hydrophobic residues

name: meprin A
reaction: Hydrolysis of protein and peptide substrates preferentially on carboxyl side of hydrophobic residues

name: procollagen C-endopeptidase
reaction: Cleavage of the C-terminal propeptide at Ala!Asp in type I and II procollagens and at Arg!Asp in type III

name: stromelysin 2
reaction: Similar to stromelysin 1, but action on collagen types III, IV and V is weak

name: matrilysin
reaction: Cleavage of Ala14!Leu and Tyr16!Leu in B chain of insulin. No action on collagen types I, II, IV, V. Cleaves gelatin chain alpha2(I) > alpha1(I)

name: gelatinase A
reaction: Cleavage of gelatin type I and collagen types IV, V, VII, X. Cleaves the collagen-like sequence Pro-Gln-Gly!Ile-Ala-Gly-Gln

name: neutrophil collagenase
reaction: Cleavage of interstitial collagens in the triple helical domain. Unlike EC 3.4.24.7, interstitial collagenase, this enzyme cleaves type III collagen more slowly than type I

name: gelatinase B
reaction: Cleavage of gelatin types I and V and collagen types IV and V

name: insulysin
reaction: Degradation of insulin, glucagon and other polypeptides. No action on proteins

name: O-sialoglycoprotein endopeptidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of O-sialoglycoproteins cleaves -Arg31!Asp- bond in glycophorin A. Does not cleave unglycosylated proteins, desialylated glycoproteins or glycoproteins that are only N-glycosylated

name: mitochondrial intermediate peptidase
reaction: Release of an N-terminal octapeptide as second stage of processing of some proteins imported into the mitochondrion

name: nardilysin
reaction: Hydrolysis of polypeptides, preferably at -Xaa!Arg-Lys-, and less commonly at -Arg!Arg-Xaa-, in which Xaa is not Arg or Lys

name: mitochondrial processing peptidase
reaction: Release of N-terminal targetting peptides from precursor proteins imported into the mitochondrion, typically with Arg in position P2

name: macrophage elastase
reaction: Hydrolysis of soluble and insoluble elastin

name: endothelin-converting enzyme 1
reaction: Hydrolysis of the -Trp21!Val- bond in big endothelin to form endothelin 1

name: pappalysin-1
reaction: Cleavage of the Met135!Lys bond in insulin-like growth factor binding protein (IGFBP)-4, and the Ser143!Lys bond in IGFBP-5

name: membrane-type matrix metalloproteinase-1
reaction: Endopeptidase activity. Activates progelatinase A by cleavage of the propeptide at Asn37!Leu. Other bonds hydrolysed include Gly35!Ile in the propeptide of collagenase 3, and Asn341!Phe, Asp441!Leu and Gln354!Thr in the aggrecan interglobular domain

name: ADAMTS-4 endopeptidase
reaction: Glutamyl endopeptidase bonds cleaved include -Thr-Glu-Gly-Glu373!Ala-Arg-Gly-Ser- in the interglobular domain of mammalian aggrecan

name: Ste24 endopeptidase
reaction: The peptide bond hydrolysed can be designated -C!aaX in which C is an S-isoprenylated cysteine residue, a is usually aliphatic and X is the C-terminal residue of the substrate protein, and may be any of several amino acids

name: S2P endopeptidase
reaction: Cleaves several transcription factors that are type-2 transmembrane proteins within membrane-spanning domains. Known substrates include sterol regulatory element-binding protein (SREBP) -1, SREBP-2 and forms of the transcriptional activator ATF6. SREBP-2 is cleaved at the site DRSR_ILL_483!CVLTFLCLSFNPLTSLLQWGGA, in which the membrane-spanning segment is underlined. The residues NP (bold), 11 residues distal to the site of cleavage in the membrane-spanning domain, are important for cleavage by S2P endopeptidase. Replacement of either of these residues does not prevent cleavage, but there is no cleavage if both of these residues are replaced.

name: ADAM 17 endopeptidase
reaction: Narrow endopeptidase specificity. Cleaves Pro-Leu-Ala-Gln-Ala!Val-Arg-Ser-Ser-Ser in the membrane-bound, 26-kDa form of tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNFalpha). Similarly cleaves other membrane-anchored, cell-surface proteins to "shed" the extracellular domains

name: proteasome endopeptidase complex
reaction: Cleavage of peptide bonds with very broad specificity

name: omega-amidase
reaction: a monoamide of a dicarboxylic acid + H2O = a dicarboxylate + NH3

name: aminoacylase
reaction: an N-acyl-L-amino acid + H2O = a carboxylate + an L-amino acid

name: ceramidase
reaction: a ceramide + H2O = a carboxylate + sphingosine

name: N-acetylmuramoyl-L-alanine amidase
reaction: Hydrolyses the link between N-acetylmuramoyl residues and L-amino acid residues in certain cell-wall glycopeptides

name: peptide-N4-(N-acetyl-beta-glucosaminyl)asparagine amidase
reaction: Hydrolysis of an N4-(acetyl-beta-D-glucosaminyl)asparagine residue in which the glucosamine residue may be further glycosylated, to yield a (substituted) N-acetyl-beta-D-glucosaminylamine and a peptide containing an aspartate residue

name: peptide deformylase
reaction: formyl-L-methionyl peptide + H2O = formate + methionyl peptide

name: histone deacetylase
reaction: Hydrolysis of an N6-acetyl-lysine residue of a histone to yield a deacetylated histone

name: protein-arginine deiminase
reaction: protein L-arginine + H2O = protein L-citrulline + NH3

name: tRNAAla(adenine37) deaminase
reaction: adenine37 in tRNAAla + H2O = hypoxanthine37 in tRNAAla + NH3

name: mRNA(cytosine6666) deaminase
reaction: cytosine6666 in apolipoprotein B mRNA + H2O = uracil6666 in apolipoprotein B mRNA + NH3

name: double-stranded RNA adenine deaminase
reaction: adenine in double-stranded RNA + H2O = hypoxanthine in double-stranded RNA + NH3

name: single-stranded DNA cytosine deaminase
reaction: cytosine in single-stranded DNA + H2O = uracil in single-stranded DNA + NH3

name: apyrase
reaction: a nucleoside 5'-triphosphate + 2 H2O = a nucleoside 5'-phosphate + 2 phosphate (overall reaction)

name: nucleoside diphosphate phosphatase
reaction: a nucleoside diphosphate + H2O = a nucleoside phosphate + phosphate

name: acylphosphatase
reaction: an acylphosphate + H2O = a carboxylate + phosphate

name: nucleoside-triphosphate phosphatase
reaction: a nucleoside triphosphate + H2O = a nucleoside diphosphate + phosphate

name: nucleoside-triphosphate diphosphatase
reaction: a nucleoside triphosphate + H2O = a nucleotide + diphosphate

name: thiamine-triphosphatase
reaction: thiamine triphosphate + H2O = thiamine diphosphate + phosphate

name: dolichyldiphosphatase
reaction: dolichyl diphosphate + H2O = dolichyl phosphate + phosphate

name: diphosphoinositol-polyphosphate diphosphatase
reaction: diphospho-myo-inositol polyphosphate + H2O = myo-inositol polyphosphate + phosphate

reaction: ATP + H2O + phospholipid[side 1] = ADP + phosphate + phospholipid[side 2]

name: Ca2+-transporting ATPase
reaction: ATP + H2O + Ca2+[side 1] = ADP + phosphate + Ca2+[side 2]

name: H+/K+-exchanging ATPase
reaction: ATP + H2O + H+in + K+out = ADP + phosphate + H+out + K+in

name: H+-transporting two-sector ATPase
reaction: ATP + H2O + H+in = ADP + phosphate + H+out

name: arsenite-transporting ATPase
reaction: ATP + H2O + arsenitein = ADP + phosphate + arseniteout

name: Cu+-exporting ATPase
reaction: ATP + H2O + Cu+[side 1] = ADP + phosphate + Cu+[side 2]

name: diphosphomevalonate decarboxylase
reaction: ATP + (R)-5-diphosphomevalonate = ADP + phosphate + isopentenyl diphosphate + CO2

name: peptidyl-glutamate 4-carboxylase
reaction: peptidyl-4-carboxyglutamate + 2,3-epoxyphylloquinone + H2O = peptidyl-glutamate + CO2 + O2 + phylloquinone

name: very-long-chain (3R)-3-hydroxyacyl-[acyl-carrier protein] dehydratase
reaction: a very-long-chain (3R)-3-hydroxyacyl-[acyl-carrier protein] = a very-long-chain trans-2,3-dehydroacyl-[acyl-carrier protein] + H2O

name: DNA-(apurinic or apyrimidinic site) lyase
reaction: The C-O-P bond 3' to the apurinic or apyrimidinic site in DNA is broken by a beta-elimination reaction, leaving a 3'-terminal unsaturated sugar and a product with a terminal 5'-phosphate

name: selenocysteine lyase
reaction: L-selenocysteine + reduced acceptor = selenide + L-alanine + acceptor

name: protein disulfide-isomerase
reaction: Catalyses the rearrangement of -S-S- bonds in proteins

name: DNA topoisomerase
reaction: ATP-independent breakage of single-stranded DNA, followed by passage and rejoining

name: DNA topoisomerase (ATP-hydrolysing)
reaction: ATP-dependent breakage, passage and rejoining of double-stranded DNA
